SENT.plain: Type 2 diabetes, whose prevalence has increased among elderly aged over 75Â years, has a number of specific features which differ from that in young people: heterogeneous population, association with other cardiovascular risk factors and several comorbidities, different therapeutic constraints and risks, and lower life expectancy
By using a standardized geriatric assessment it is possible to determine therapeutic and glycemic goals for each patient
In the elderly, main complications of diabetes are hypoglycemia and foot lesions
In order to avoid malnutrition, lifestyle and dietary rules should not be too strict

Recommendations for the prescription of oral antidiabetic agents are the same for both elderly and young subjects, but with increased monitoring in the elderly because of the high risk of complications including iatrogenic hypoglycemia
